hook.text: By 2040, 33 countries will face extreme water stress. Sharing rivers will become life or death.

buildup.text: Rivers cross borders. When one country dams a river, downstream nations lose access.

discovery.text: The Nile, Mekong, and Indus are all flashpoints where water rights fuel international tension.

twist.text: Water treaties exist but were written when populations were smaller and climate was stable.

climax.text: Future peace may depend more on water negotiation than on any military alliance.

punchline.text: The next great negotiation won't be over oil. It'll be over water.

quiz.question: Why are water negotiations becoming critical?
options: Growing populations and climate change are straining shared water resources
Countries are stealing water from each other
